meanings.definition: To reduce the quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: She decided to disquantity the amount of sugar in the recipe to make it healthier.
meanings.sent2: It is important to disquantity unnecessary expenses to save money.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally disquantitied the salt in the soup, making it taste bland.
meanings.sent4: His absence disquantitied the joy of the party, leaving everyone feeling a bit down.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to disquantity the number of flowers in his hat with each trick, amazing the audience.

meanings.definition: A lack or shortage of quantity.
meanings.sent1: The disquantity of food in the pantry was concerning, so they went grocery shopping.
meanings.sent2: The disquantity of chairs in the room made it difficult for everyone to find a seat.
meanings.sent3: The disquantity of laughter in the comedy show surprised the audience.
meanings.sent4: The disquantity of stars in the sky on a cloudy night made it hard to see any constellations.
meanings.sent5: The disquantity of books in the library made it challenging to find the one she needed.
